embed.description: It's 2018, which means another year of new champions and VGUs has begun! I thought now would be a great time to talk about some of the Champions Team's plans for the year. Let's skip the long intro and get right into what you all came here for: sweet, sweet champion teasers.

Well Yorick came roughly a month before the harrowing and Eve came roughly a month later,so it would definetly be fitting(and honestly I wouldn't be sad if we got a Mordekaiser rework,because I am looking forward to that too).

However we pretty much know already what to expect from a Mordekaiser VGU,after all Mordes lore got updated already and the direction seems pretty solid.

Meanwhile Kayle and Morgana have more or less no lore at all and riot will probably be unable to make any angel-related champions until they updated these 2.

But that is same for Akali too. Look at Akali, they are officially saying narrative wise it will be not a new Akali, just a expended one. As i would expect from Mordekaiser.

They are going with which theme we have the best in our hand right now than which champion needs the most.

There are 2 differences between the update for Akali and the one for Mordekaiser:

1.Morde has a pretty solid theme already,he is a death knight and an evil overlord.Those are cool fantasies that he doesn't share with anyone else in the whole roster.Meanwhile Akalis current theme is that she is a "ninja assassin" as riot stated it,which isn't really unique considering that {{champion:238}} is pretty much the same thing only with the added bonus of using shadow clones as well.
This means there will be a new element to Akalis theme that we don't know about yet(judging by the teaser it might be smoke related)


2.Mordes lore is far more detailed than Akalis,it gives us a lot of insight about his life before and after death,as well as his plans and goals.Meanwhile Akalis lores is one of the blandest in the entire game,its essentially just "she was trained by her mother and succeeded in her role as the fist of shadow".
They can pretty much invent a new lore for akali and just add it on top of the old one,that'd be no problem.
